unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Confidence Interval Purposes
question_text:
A confidence interval can be used to:
I. Estimate a population mean.
II. Estimate a sample mean.
III. Estimate the difference between two populations.
solution:
Statement I is true; a confidence interval can take a sample mean and help give a range where the unknown population mean could be.

Statement II is false; there is no reason to construct an interval to estimate sample mean as the sample mean can easily be calculated with the data gathered.

Statement III is true; when dealing with two sample means or two sample proportions, a confidence interval can be used to estimate the difference in the populations.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
